titles.title: A bill to protect patent owners from importation into the United States of goods made overseas by use of a United States patented process.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Courts, Civil Liberties, and the Administration of Justice.

committee.subcommittee: Courts, Civil Liberties, and the Administration of Justice
committee.name: House Judiciary

bill.summary: 1/6/1987--Introduced. Amends the patent laws to make it an infringement of patent to use, sell, or import into the United States without authority a product produced by a patented process. Places the burden of proof upon the party asserting that a product was not produced with the patented process in an infringement action where the court finds a substantial likelihood that the product was so produced and the claimant has exhausted all means of discovery.
